English_Translation: "Answer the question we asked you! And who asked you about the horses?", they insisted.
Russian_Translation: Ты отвечай на вопрос, заданный нами, а кто у тебя про коней спросил мол, настаивали они.

Tsez_Line: Där retinäy di guluƛ’no zawƛin, eƛin žeduqor guluzaxoza.
English_Translation: "I will ride on a horse whenever I want," said the horseman.
Russian_Translation: Если захочу, я могу и на коня сесть мол, сказал конюх.

Tsez_Line: Yedan ʕabdal yołƛin, bazarganbi elaygon bitor bik’in.
English_Translation: "He is an idiot as well," [said] the merchants [and] went away from there.
Russian_Translation: Он тоже дурак мол, купцы пошли оттуда еще дальше.

Tsez_Line: Butnoƛ’ pun bok’no äčiru žek’ur bazarganbi igoxxo bukayruntow, q’ecno rutirno, nełaƛ’ ƛ’iri k’ukno eqerno, yizi bayace butnoƛ’ puƛ’orno c’oxno, k’ukyoƛ’or ezun ičin.
English_Translation: When the person lying on his burka saw the merchants approaching, he collected dirt, put a cap over it and lied down on the burka again until they came; then he waited watching his cap.
Russian_Translation: Человек, который лежал на бурке увидев идущих из далека купцов, собрал грязь, поставил на ней шапку, лег на бурку и, глядя на шапку, ждал их прибытия.

Tsez_Line: ƛ’irir baynosi, bazarganza esirno nesiq, łeno ħumukulin boc’no howt’aza ik’ix deber uži ukaynč’aƛin.
English_Translation: When they had come closer, the merchants asked him: "Have you seen a boy going in this direction driving five camels?"
Russian_Translation: Когда поближе подошли, купцы спросили их, не видел ли ты юношу, идущего отсюда прогоняя пять верблюдов.

Tsez_Line: Nesä žawab teƛno, meža šebigo royłin k’ukyoƛ yałru šebin di mežuq rukarinč’iƛin.
English_Translation: He replied: "Although you do what[ever?](?), I won't show you what I got under the cap."
Russian_Translation: Он ответил, что бы вы не сделаете, я вам не покажу то, что находится под шапкой.

Tsez_Line: Rukarƛin, yizi ʕuraw ƛ’iri butinosi, butnoƛ’ pun bok’no ičin zawruni žek’a eƛin, di bitaɣorno ik’in ayzaƛ’or, yedu k’uk biqirno bičinäy, mežuq di t’o yałru šebin rukaranƛin.
English_Translation: "Show it!", [they said and] when they insisted heavily, the man lying on the burka said: "When you hold my cap while I will go away and come back, I will show you the thing that is here."
Russian_Translation: Когда они очень настаивали, мол покажи, человек, лежавший на бурке, сказал, если до моего возвращения оттуда вы будете держать эту шапку мол, я вам покажу то, что здесь находится.

Tsez_Line: Bazarganbi k’uk biqiran begirno, ža yołi žedur ukaynč’izaɣorno ik’in, butnoƛ’ pun caƛin, žeduƛ’ ezun ičäsi zown.
English_Translation: The merchants stopped holding the cap; he, however, went to a place were they couldn't see him, put himself on the burka and waited watching them.
Russian_Translation: Купцов оставили держать шапку и тот пошел в невидимое им место, лег на бурке и смотрел на них.

Tsez_Line: Nesiqorno bezun bičin yiziq ʕuraw mix bik’in.
English_Translation: Waiting and looking for him, much time passed for them.
Russian_Translation: Долго подождав их у них прошло много времени.

Tsez_Line: Yeda ayatow aynč’izaƛ’, nazon žeda, šebi yedu t’o nece rigu šebinƛin, k’ukyoƛxor reƛ’abi regirnosi, q’ecas ric’äsit’a roƛixno.
English_Translation: Because he really didn't come, they all put their hands under the cap [to see] what oh-so-pretty thing there is, and the took it out full of dirt.
Russian_Translation: Когда он никак не возвращался, все они пустили туда руки, что тут такое хорошее мол, и вынули полные грязью.

Tsez_Line: Yisän eli baƛ’irsiƛin, elaygon bitor bazarganbi hunix boqno, waranibin rižin äk’iru žaz ʕaƛaɣorno bezun.
English_Translation: "He cheated us as well," the merchants [said and] got on their way away from their and looked for the village of the boy who went leading the camels.
Russian_Translation: Он тоже мол нас обманул, оттуда дальше продолжили путь, глядя в сторону села юноши, который шел с верблюдами.

Tsez_Line: Elor baynosi, yizä žas ɣˤutkun resurno, idurno, bik’in eƛin, mi eli baƛ’irno, elus ħumukulibin, žedaƛ’ ƛ’iri zawru q’ayn elus eluqor xizor butirno neƛƛin.
English_Translation: When they arrived there, they found the boy's house, went inside and said: "You tricked us, give us back our camels and the goods that were on them!"
Russian_Translation: Пришли туда, нашли дом юноши, пошли домой и сказали, ты нас обманул, наши верблюды с товаром на них верните обратно и дай нам мол.

Tsez_Line: Mežus kinaw šebin di xizor rutirno mežus mežuqor neƛan, meža ža karamałi yołalini hibo dey däqor bayrnäyƛin, žawab teƛno žoyä žedur.
English_Translation: "I will give all your things back to you, if you give me back my magic wand," answered the boy them.
Russian_Translation: Я ваши вещи все возвращу вам, если вы тоже вернете мне мою волшебную палочку мол, ответил юноша.

Tsez_Line: Bazarganza eƛin, debi hibo ela becursiƛin.
English_Translation: The merchants said: "We broke your stick."
Russian_Translation: Купцы сказали, мы поломали твою палку мол.

Tsez_Line: Nedur resunäy, däqay mežur ħumukulibin, žedaƛ’osi šebinon räqinč’iƛin, eƛin oqno yeda užin ičin.
English_Translation: "If that's the case, you won't get the camels and what is on them from me," said the boy and remained.
Russian_Translation: Если так, вы тоже у меня не получите верблюды и то, что на них мол, сказал и остался.

Tsez_Line: Didurnotow yiziq sidaƛ’or hut’ rutinč’izaƛ’, yizis šarʕimoƛ’ bik’anix q’ut’i boqno.
English_Translation: Because they could not reach a consensus, they agreed to go to the Sharia.
Russian_Translation: Они никак не могли прийти к единому мнению и они договорились (решить вопрос) по шариату.

Tsez_Line: Dibirderno bik’in yizä nesiq raqru šebin esin, łin, bišan neła bok’-bak’za roƛik’xosiƛin, hiboƛ yisi žar ela ħumukulibin žedaƛ’osi q’ayn ħažäsi zows, amma ža buysitow hibo zown.
English_Translation: They went to the imam and told him what had happened: "Water and food appeared where he hit the stick onto, and we exchanged camels and the goods on them against the stick, but [then] it was just a simple stick.
Russian_Translation: Пошли к имаму они рассказали о том, что было, мы верблюды с товаром поменяли ему палку, мол на том месте где его бьют появляются вода и еда, но она оказалась обычной палкой.

Tsez_Line: Xizyo ža ela cimyoqaysi becurno boɣsiƛin.
English_Translation: Afterwards we broke it out of rage and threw it away."
Russian_Translation: Потом от злости мы ее поломали.

Tsez_Line: Becurinč’ey di täƛru biłetow däqorno meža hibo bayrsi yołi, din mežus mežuqor rutirno kinaw šebin neƛa zowsƛin.
English_Translation: "If you hadn't broken it, you could have brought me back one that were as the one I gave to you, then I would have given you back all your stuff."
Russian_Translation: Если бы вы не поломав принесли бы мне палку такую же, какую я вам отдал, я тоже мол вернул бы и все отдал бы вам.

Tsez_Line: C’aq’ bit’araw eƛisƛin, dibirän eƛin, q’ˤimbin wˤałer rˤoq’urno bazarganbin bik’in, žar q’aymos ric’äsi ħumukulibin xecin.
English_Translation: "Very well said," said the imam and the merchants hung their hads and went away, leaving the camels with the goods to the boy.
Russian_Translation: Очень правильно сказал мол, ответил имам, опустив головы купцы тоже пошли, оставив юноше верблюды полные товаром.

Tsez_Line: K’uruč’ k’eč’, ɣudi rocu, buq bay.
English_Translation: All's well that ends well.
Russian_Translation: Куруч, бусина, пусть день проясняется, а солнце восходит.

Tsez_Line: Zownƛax zownanuƛax eni-babiwn žedusgon sistow sis užin.
English_Translation: Once upon a time there was a couple who had only one son.
Russian_Translation: Был говорят, не был отец и мать, у них еще один единственный сын.

Tsez_Line: Žeda besurozaƛ’ay ʕumru boyx zown.
English_Translation: They were living from fishing.
Russian_Translation: Они жили за счет рыб.

Tsez_Line: Sida quł užiz rok’ƛ’or rayn, netintow däde sadaq babiwn äčinč’i, din besurobi riqiranix ruhun oqa ayƛin.
English_Translation: One day the son thought: "My father won't always live with me, I need to learn how to catch fish."
Russian_Translation: В один день сын вспомнил, не будет же всегда со мной жить отец, мне тоже надо научиться поймать рыб мол.

Tsez_Line: Sasaq izin uži iƛi-šeƛ’uƛ’oräy, babiya esirno nesiq, q’arłäytow nar mi q’ač’azi oqxoƛin.
English_Translation: The next morning, when the boy got up and got dressed, the father asked him: "Where are you heading to, so early?"
Russian_Translation: Утром, когда сын оделся, отец спросил его, куда ты так рано собираешься мол.

Tsez_Line: Užä žawab teƛno, yaqˤuł di besurozaƛ’or ik’ixƛin.
English_Translation: The son replied: "Today I am going fishing."
Russian_Translation: Сын ответил, сегодня я на на рыбалку иду мол.

Tsez_Line: Sosisi egirxanuƛin babiw ƛ’iri utin, xizyo necetow nesir retizaƛ’, egirno xecin.
English_Translation: At first the father insisted in not letting him go, but then - because he wanted it so much - he let him leave.
Russian_Translation: Сперва отец не пускал, затем раз он так хочет отпустил.

Tsez_Line: Neła quł užiq siskin besuron biqinanu, hudu haq’un quqa ƛexun.
English_Translation: On that day, the boy didn't get any fish, so the family remained hungry.
Russian_Translation: В тот день он не поймал ни одну рыбу, поэтому семья осталась голодной.

Tsez_Line: Hudayzikon uži besurozaƛ’or ik’in, hemedurtow biqinč’ey aynosi, babiw igza ħalał aƛ’in.
English_Translation: The next day when the boy went after fish again, didn't catch any either and came back, the father scolded him pretty much.
Russian_Translation: На следующий день тоже пошел на рыбалку, также не поймав вернулся и отец сильно поругал.

Tsez_Line: Łˤono äƛiru ɣudełno, babiws ħal bayrinč’ey, besurozaƛ’or užitow ik’in.
English_Translation: And on the third day, although the father was against it, the boy went fishing nonetheless.
Russian_Translation: На третий день тоже, как бы отец ни был против, на рыбалку пошел сын.

Tsez_Line: Neła quł ħaƛ’ala yisiq łˤono besuro biqin.
English_Translation: On that day, he hardly caught three fish.
Russian_Translation: В тот день с трудом он поймал три рыбы.

Tsez_Line: Bisno q’ˤano besuron bac’ad boyn, łˤono äƛiru boyƛ’oräy, nełaz k’esma aɣiw qˤod yesun.
English_Translation: He took two fish and cleaned them, and when he took the third one, he found a hole in its gullet.
Russian_Translation: Взяли и почистили две рыбы, когда чистили третью в ее пищеводе нашли дырку.

Tsez_Line: Bercingo xal boynosi, besuroz qeqa teł t’akan c’oxäsi yesun.
English_Translation: When he examined it better, he found a broken glass.
Russian_Translation: Посмотрели как следует, и во рту рыбы нашли застрявшего стакана.

Tsez_Line: Žan elay yoɣno, sosi łäłxor kuranƛin oqno yeda.
English_Translation: He took it out of there and at first wanted to throw it into the water.
Russian_Translation: Вытащил его оттуда и хотел он бросать его в воду.

Tsez_Line: Xizyogon, łi ħaƛa yołin yetas yeduƛin, rok’ƛ’or pikrun bayn, xecin.
English_Translation: Then he thought, it might be useful to drink water with, and so he left.
Russian_Translation: Потом подумал, пригодиться мол хоть для питья воды и оставил.

Tsez_Line: Dahaw ičintow, t’akan č’aq’ˤi-yaq’ˤirno łäsno yic’no ħaƛun łiynosi, suƛƛixtow mesedyos yic’no yik’in.
English_Translation: He waited a little, shaked the glass and filled it with water; when he finished drinking, the glass suddenly filled with gold.
Russian_Translation: Немного подождал, взболтал, наполнил водой и после того, как выпил вдруг заполнился золотом.

Tsez_Line: K’ox äƛiru ħaƛunosin, hemedurtown yic’no.
English_Translation: When he drank once more, it filled itself again.
Russian_Translation: Когда выпил второй раз, также заполнился.

Tsez_Line: T’akanyar bayru mesedno ħiƛ’oqax butirno čantan eqerno, łˤonon besuron bižin uži iduɣor ik’in.
English_Translation: The boy gathered the gold that came int the glass into a handkerchief, put it inside his pocket and carried the three fish home.
Russian_Translation: Золото, которое появилось в стакане, завернул в носовой платок, положил в карман, забрал три рыбы и пошел домой.

Tsez_Line: Hunix ik’iƛ’oräy, yisir łˤonon roƛnoxut’a bazarganbi keze boqno.
English_Translation: While walking on his way, he encountered three sick merchants.
Russian_Translation: По пути он встречает три больных купца.

Tsez_Line: Yiziqor doxturä eƛäsi zown, besuro bac’näy neła roƛxosi ričär mežusƛin.
English_Translation: A doctor had said to them: "If you eat fish, this will stop you from being sick."
Russian_Translation: Им врач советовал, мол если вы будете есть рыбу, то ваше здоровье поправится.

Tsez_Line: Užiq žedur besurobi rukayzaƛ’, elur neƛƛin harizi rodin.
English_Translation: When they saw the fish, they begged the boy: "Give them to us!"
Russian_Translation: Увидев у юноши рыбы, они попросили, дай нам мол.

Tsez_Line: Hemedur, dey idu quqa eni-babiw yołƛin žoyä eƛinosi, bazarganza eƛin, ela deber rac’an, šeƛ’an neƛan, ƛ’irigon mi idur ayranix ħumukulin begirno sadaq sis bazarganno egiranƛin.
English_Translation: When the boy said: "My hungry parents are at home", the merchants said: "We will give you to eat and to dress and above that, we'll give you a camel to bring you home and we will send one merchant with you."
Russian_Translation: Когда юноша сказал, что его дома ждут голодные родители, купцы сказали, мы тебе дадим кушать и одеваться, дополнительно еще, чтобы доставить тебя домой отправим верблюда и одного купца мол.

Tsez_Line: Nełaƛ’ užin razi oqno.
English_Translation: The boy agreed on that.
Russian_Translation: Юноша тоже согласился с этим.

Tsez_Line: Q’ˤanosi bazargan žeda žeduz hunixno bik’in, sideni ħumukuliƛ’ zowrno uži ʕaƛar ayra nexno.
English_Translation: Two merchants went on their way, the other one seated the boy onto the camel and brought him into the village.
Russian_Translation: Двое купцов пошли по своей дороге, а другой пошел провожать юношу на верблюде до села.

Tsez_Line: Yizi nexxo bukayrun, žas babiw žedus hunärƛin nexƛ’oräy, užä xexłiƛ’ ħumukuliƛ’ay q’ayn boɣno bazargan xizor utirno.
English_Translation: When the boy's father came on their way as he saw them coming, the boy quickly took the goods off the camel and the merchant went back.
Russian_Translation: Увидел, что они идут отец юноши шел им на встречу, а сын скорее снял с верблюда товар и купца вернул обратно.

Tsez_Line: Di žek’anč’e babiw nexxoƛin, yoł yałzatow q’ayn xecin užin oxin.
English_Translation: Thinking that the father came to beat him, the boy left the goods where they were and ran away.
Russian_Translation: Отец идет, чтобы меня бить мол, оставляет там же товар и юноша убежал.

Tsez_Line: Yedu q’ay idur bayrƛin baruqorno eƛin, babiw užił xizay k’oƛin.
English_Translation: "Bring these goods into the house!", the father told his wife and ran behind his son.
Russian_Translation: Этот товар доставь домой мол, сказал жене, отец побежал за сыном.

Tsez_Line: Naysinan k’edin, xalq’imoq esirno, esaniqaysi buži łiynosi, babiw xizo-q’ˤimer utin iduɣor nexno.
English_Translation: Having searched everywhere and having asked the people, the father didn't have any hope of finding him anymore, turned back and went home.
Russian_Translation: Везде, всюду спрашивал у людей, потерял надежду найти и отец вернулся обратно домой.

Tsez_Line: Uži yołi sida šaharyaɣorno ik’in, elo raht’ateles ħalt’i k’eyx aħnayx zown.
English_Translation: The boy however went to a city and walked around searching for a work as a servant.
Russian_Translation: Сын пошел в один город и искал работу дворового.

Tsez_Line: Zamanałäy yeda sida xander ħalt’in esirno aynosi, nesä indowrizas aħołun egirno.
English_Translation: After some time, he came to ask for work at the king's, and that one let him work as a turkey herder.
Russian_Translation: Через некоторое время он пришел к одному царю и он пустил его пастухом индюков.

Tsez_Line: Sida quł užä neširaɣor indowribin rayrno, čantay t’akanno yisno eƛin, howt’o mečoƛ’ ɣˤutkun, elo teł rigu ist’owlin, nełaqgon šet’ur q’ˤuribin roqoƛƛin.
English_Translation: One day the young man brought the turkeys [home] in the evening, took the glass out of his pocke and said: "May here on the field be a house and inside a good table and chairs around it!"
Russian_Translation: Однажды вечером юноша привел индюков, взял из кармана стакан и сказал, пусть на этом месте будут дом, там внутри хороший стол со столами.

Tsez_Line: Ɣˤutkaɣor bäk’izaz puƛ’aza q’ˤano rut’ugan rixoƛ ƛ’irin caxno, sidaƛ’ “sisxoli xanes kid yayoƛƛin”, sideniƛ’gon “nasin xalq’i bayoƛƛin”.
English_Translation: And over the entrance to the house, let there hang two carpets on which shall be written on the one side: "May the princess come alone!" and on the other one: "May all people come!"!
Russian_Translation: Со стороны входа дома пусть висят два ковра с надписьями на одной «пусть одна придет царевна», на другой «пусть придут все люди».

Tsez_Line: Hudayziko xanez kidbä neła nełas ɣarabaš yezu-yoƛ’ˤanix łeno minutno beč’no bazaryaɣor yegirno.
English_Translation: The next day, the princess sent her own servant to the market for five minutes to have a look.
Russian_Translation: На следующий день царевна свою служанку на пять минут отправила на базар, чтобы посмотреть.

Tsez_Line: Ɣarabaš oc’ira minutya kʷat’izin yoqno yayn.
English_Translation: The servant came ten minutes late.
Russian_Translation: Служанка опоздала на десять минут и пришла.

Tsez_Line: Šida mi elo nece mixƛ’or yičäƛin, xanes kid c’ok’inayn nełqor.
English_Translation: "Why did it take you so much time?", the princess scolded her.
Russian_Translation: Царевна ругала ее, почему ты так долго задержалась там мол.

Tsez_Line: Mi yik’äsi zows yołi, elotow łemu ƛäxuƛin, žawab teƛno ɣarabašä.
English_Translation: "If you had gone, you would have stayed there.", answered the servant.
Russian_Translation: Если бы ты пошла осталась бы там же мол, ответила служанка.

Tsez_Line: Sida quł xanes kid bazaryaɣorno yik’in, xizor yutin nexƛ’oräy, nesi žaz ɣˤutkaɣor yik’in.
English_Translation: One day, the princess went to the market and when she came back, the came toward the house of that boy.
Russian_Translation: В один день царевна пошла на базар, когда шла обратно, зашла в дом этого юноши.

Tsez_Line: Ža madaxor yaynosi, oƛixno k’oƛin užä, tełxor yoqƛin, iduɣor goƛ’in.
English_Translation: When she came to the door, the boy came running and invited her into the home: "Come inside!"
Russian_Translation: Когда она пришла во двор, появился юноша и пригласил ее домой.

Tsez_Line: Teł idu yiłar riguƛ’ay rigu bišadyos ric’äsi istowli resun.
English_Translation: Inside the house, she found a table set with the best food.
Russian_Translation: В доме она нашла полный стол лучшей еды.

Tsez_Line: Q’ˤanon q’ˤidan bičin biš-butin łiynosi, užä nełqor ħaƛanix łäsno yic’no besuroz haqa yesun zawruni t’akan teƛno.
English_Translation: The two sat down and when they had finished eating, the boy filled the glass he found in the fish's mouth with water and gave it to her to drink.
Russian_Translation: Сели в двоем и после того как закончили кушать, юноша дал ей полный стакан воды, который им был найден во рту рыбы.

Tsez_Line: Łi ħaƛun łäyrun, mesedyos ža yic’nosi, xanes kid tamaša yoqno ƛexun.
English_Translation: When the princess finished drinking the water, it filled with gold and she was very surprised.
Russian_Translation: После того, как закончила пить воду, он наполнился золотом и царевна удивилась.

Tsez_Line: Howlotow xanez kidbes nesiqor roƛ’i boqno.
English_Translation: Then the princess fell in love with him.
Russian_Translation: Тут же царевна влюбилась в него.

Tsez_Line: Ža xabargon, xanez kidber indowrizaxosi aħo etixƛin, naysinan bay-texno.
English_Translation: And the story that the princess loved a turkey herder, spread everywhere.
Russian_Translation: Этот весть, что царевна влюбилась в пастуха индюков распространилась везде и всюду.

Tsez_Line: Cimyoqaysi xanä ža kid qaciz k’emot’ya tełerno kurno, yoɣno łäłxor yižirno.
English_Translation: The malicious king locked his daughter in a wooden chest and let her throw into the river.
Russian_Translation: От злости царь закрыл эту дочь в деревянном сундуке и бросил в реку.

Tsez_Line: Neł iħux sis ʕaƛ zown.
English_Translation: Along the river was a village.
Russian_Translation: У реки стояло одно село.

Tsez_Line: Elozo ʕaƛoz žamaʕatyo łiyä rayäru qaciƛ’ay bet’erbaqi boyx zown.
English_Translation: The population of this village there made a living from the wood brought along the river.
Russian_Translation: Жители этого села жили за счет дров, которых несла река.

Tsez_Line: Sidaɣ lalašin łi räk’iza mečoƛ’, xanes kid teł yałruni k’emot’ ɣˤanazaq yiqin.
English_Translation: In one place, where the river spread out, the wooden chest with the princess inside got to a woman.
Russian_Translation: На одном месте, где вода текла широко, сундук, где была царевна нашла женщина.

Tsez_Line: Idurno yižin yiła yaɣˤin tełer yezunosi, bercinaw ƛ’iräy ozuri boɣa betixanusi, kid yesun.
English_Translation: She carried it home, opened it and when she looked inside, she found a girl so beautiful that she didn't want to take her eyes off from her.
Russian_Translation: Забрала он его с собой домой, посмотрела во внутрь и нашла такую красивую девушку, что невозможно было отвести с нее глаз.

Tsez_Line: K’emot’yay maħorno yoqno kidbä eƛin, mi łinaqnokin yaƛ’ˤno.
English_Translation: The girl got out of the chest and said: "Don't be afraid of anything!
Russian_Translation: Из сундука вышла девушка и сказала, ты не бойся ничего.

Tsez_Line: Di debi kid, mi dey eniw yiča yoł howžäy soderƛin.
English_Translation: From now on, I am your daughter and you are my mother.
Russian_Translation: Я твоей дочерью, а ты моей мамой будешь отныне мол.

Tsez_Line: Sida quł kidbä eniwłun yäsruni ɣˤanabi neła nełaz bašiłäy bašiqˤoyn roɣno, bazaryaɣor teƛa yegirno.
English_Translation: One day, the girl let the woman who had become her mother sell the ring that she took off her finger on the market.
Russian_Translation: Однажды девушка вынула с своего пальца кольцо и отправила названную мать на базара, чтобы ее продавать.

Tsez_Line: Yedu risxozo žek’uqor mi eƛoƛin, eƛin kidbä nełqor, debeq yiłas bašiqˤoy baha bäzinč’iƛin.
English_Translation: "Say to the person who wants to buy it:" the girl told her, "'You won't affort the price.'
Russian_Translation: Девушка сказала, скажи тому, кто хочет купить это кольцо, что ты не осилишь ее стоимость мол...

Tsez_Line: Bäziƛin nesä eƛinäy, ža mi däder aƛin.
English_Translation: When he says: 'I will!', bring him to me!"
Russian_Translation: ...и приведи его ко мне.

Tsez_Line: Neła quł sasaqtow ža ɣˤanabi bašiqˤoyn koyär risno rukarxo bazarya yäčizay, ayn sida užä nełas baha šebiƛin esirnosi, neła debeq yiłas baha bäzinč’iƛin eƛin.
English_Translation: The next day in the morning, the woman was showing around the ring on her hand, and while being on the market, a boy came and asked: "What's its price?"; she said: "You won't afford its price."
Russian_Translation: На следующий же день эта женщина с кольцом на руках показывая ходила по базару, пришел один юноша спросил о стоимости кольца, она сказала, что ты не осилишь ее стоимость мол.

Tsez_Line: Däq nełas baha bäziƛin užä eƛinosi, yiła yeda idur kidbeder ayrno.
English_Translation: "I will be able to afford its price.", the boy said, and she led him home to the girl.
Russian_Translation: Когда он сказал, что я осилю ее стоимость она привела его к девушке.

Tsez_Line: Sider sis bukayrun, yizä ałnibin ric’no, kidbä “eniwqor” eƛin, mi łinaqnokin ħayran yaqno, eli ɣˤana-xediw yołƛin.
English_Translation: When they saw each other, they hugged each other and the girl said to her 'mother': "Don't be so surprised about anything, we're a couple!"
Russian_Translation: Увидели они друг друга, обнимались и девушка сказала «матери», ты ничему не удивляйся, мы есть мол муж и жена.

Tsez_Line: Neširu beciƛ’ q’ˤanon maħorno boqno, t’akanno yisno užä eƛin, ulkałkin anunč’uruq’aw, xanbin, wazirbin bišxosi, riguƛ’ay rigu teł šebin yołäsi magazin roqoƛƛin.
English_Translation: In the evening by moonlight, the two got outside and the boy took the glass and said: "May there be a shop where the best things are in, which the kings and viziers eat...."
Russian_Translation: В лунную ночь вдвоем вышли на улицу, юноша взял стакан и сказал, пусть у нас будет магазин, которого нету в стране, где едят цари и визири и лучшими вещами.

Tsez_Line: Sasaqor žeda äƛiza mečoƛ’ yizir bercinaw magazinno, elotow teł xanzarsi biłe bišxosi močin, icozaƛ’gon biguƛ’ay bigu q’ayn besun.
English_Translation: In the morning, on the place where they spoke, they found a beautiful shop with the best articles on the shelfs and a place to eat like for a king in it.
Russian_Translation: До утра на том месте, где они сказали нашли красивый магазин, там внутри же место как для царей, чтобы кушать, а на полках лучшие товары.

Tsez_Line: Sida quł elor bišanixƛin xanno, nesisgon wazirbin bayn.
English_Translation: One day, the king and his vizier came there in order to eat.
Russian_Translation: Однажды туда пришли кушать царь и его визири.

Tsez_Line: Babiw išƛ’oräy, kidbä nesił adäz mesedyos yic’äsi t’akan eqerno.
English_Translation: While the father was eating, his daughter put the glass full of gold in front of him.
Russian_Translation: Когда отец ел, дочь поставила перед ним стакан полный золота.

Tsez_Line: (Nesir riyx zownanu ža nesis kid yałrułi).
English_Translation: (He didn't know it was his daughter).
Russian_Translation: (Он не знал, что она его дочь).

Tsez_Line: Išno łiynosi, xan ƛ’iri utin, ža t’akan där neƛƛin.
English_Translation: When he finished eating, the king insisted: "Give me this glass!"
Russian_Translation: После того как ел, царь настаивал, что дайте мне этот стакан мол.

Tsez_Line: (Nełƛ’or adertown kidbä seru ħišixosi ɣˤalu-muži rodäsi ričix).
English_Translation: (The daughter put a saddle on it, which one could open and close).
Russian_Translation: (Задолго до этого девушка соорудила седло, которого можно закрывать или открывать).

Tsez_Line: Kidbä eƛin, ƛ’iri ɣˤalu-mužin erno, ƛ’irigon din zowrno mi ʕaƛoz č’imäy č’imär ik’inäy, mesedyosni t’akan debi yiča yołƛin.
English_Translation: The girl said: "When you put this saddle on, seat me on it and you go from one corner of the village to another, the glass of gold will be yours."
Russian_Translation: Девушка сказала, если ты пойдешь из одного угла села в другой с седлом на верху, посадив меня там, то стакан золота твой будет мол.

Tsez_Line: Xanä pikru boyn, mesedyos yic’äsi t’akan yiqinäy, šida ƛ’iri ɣˤalu-mužin erno kid zowra yayxanuƛin.
English_Translation: The king thought: "If I get the glass filled with gold, why not put a saddle on and seat the girl on it."
Russian_Translation: Царь подумал, если получу стакан золота, почему бы нельзя поставить на верху (на спине) седло и посадить туда девушку.

Tsez_Line: Bayru q’ut’oƛ’ xan razi oqno.
English_Translation: The king agreed on the contract to do so.
Russian_Translation: Царь согласился с договором.

Tsez_Line: Kidbä nesiz gugyoƛ’ ɣˤalu-mužin erno, bercingo lilyon č’odirno, zowanƛin sis xot’o ɣˤalumoƛ’ ernosi neła eƛin, kidbes baqru ʕeze boqinč’ey, babiwsno boqäwa mesedyoz t’akanyoqor roƛ’iƛin.
English_Translation: The girl put the saddle over his back, fastened the strap tightly, and when she put one foot into the saddle to sit down, she said: "It wasn't enough that girl felt in love, did also the father fell in love with that glass of gold?"
Russian_Translation: Девушка поставила на нем седло, хорошенько затянула ремень, когда одну ногу поставила на седло, чтобы садиться, она сказала, не хватило, что дочь и отец тоже влюбился в стакан золота мол.

Tsez_Line: Ža teqnosi, xan ničzin oqno, gugyoƛ’ ƛ’iritow ħiširuqasi ɣˤalu-mužin rižin, nesä nesiz ʕaƛaɣor oxin.
English_Translation: When hearing this, the king got ashamed and with the saddle mounted on his back, he ran off into his own village.
Russian_Translation: Услышав это, царь постыдился  и с закрытым седлом на верху (на спине) сбежал в свое село.

Tsez_Line: Elus xan oxisƛin, nesiłgon xizaz wazirbin čˤaƛin bik’in.
English_Translation: [Saying] "Our king ran away!", his viziers went running behind him.
Russian_Translation: Наш царь сбежал мол и за ним побежали визири.

Tsez_Line: ʕAƛar aynosi, xanä ƛ’iri ɣˤalu-mužin risno, siskin ɣˤutka tełxor xalq’in begirinč’ey, uqˤełno ičäsi zown.
English_Translation: When he came into the village with the saddle on, he didn't let anyone come into the house and hid away.
Russian_Translation: Пришел в село царь с седлом на верху, скрылся и никого не пускал домой.

Tsez_Line: Šomon žek’u oqno nesiƛ’ay ɣˤalu-muži roɣaƛin...
English_Translation: How many a man tried to get the saddle of him...
Russian_Translation: Сколько людей старались снять с него седло…

Tsez_Line: Ɣˤalu seranix indowrizaxosi aħo goƛ’anix xanä wazirbi begirno baynosi, k’oƛin yik’in kidbätow serun.
English_Translation: He sent his viziers to call the turkey herder to open the saddle, but his daughter came running and opened it.
Russian_Translation: Чтобы открыть седло за пастухом индюков отправил визиров, но побежала сама дочь и открыл.

Tsez_Line: Xanä ixiw bertenno boyn, indowrizaz aħozix kidno yegirno.
English_Translation: The king organized a big wedding and married his daughter off to the turkey herder.
Russian_Translation: Царь сыграл большую свадьбу и за пастуха индюков выдал свою дочь.

Tsez_Line: Boƛƛo baq’ˤu zaman bik’izaƛ’ortow užä eni-babiwn bown, t’akanyoz kumakyoƛ’aza xanzode igo rigu ɣˤutkun royn, łinałnokin boƛ-t’oƛunč’ey žeda bercinłiƛ’ ʕumrun bižin.
English_Translation: After quite some time has passed, the boy brought his parents and with the help of the glass, he built a pretty house near the king's [place], and without having to worry about anything, they led a life in beauty.
Russian_Translation: Не прошло много времени, юноша привел родителей, с помощью стакана рядом с царским построил хороший дом и без особых беспокойств продолжали жить красиво.

Tsez_Line: Zownƛax zownanuƛax q’ˤano bazargan.
English_Translation: Once upon a time there were two merchants.
Russian_Translation: Был говорят, не был два купца.

Tsez_Line: Žedu bik’in sadaq q’ay teƛ-bok’a sida ʕaƛaɣor.
English_Translation: They went to a village together to sell articles.
Russian_Translation: Вместе они пошли для продажи товара в одно село.

Tsez_Line: Žedude sadaq kumakyor xalq’in zown.
English_Translation: And they had people with them for help.
Russian_Translation: Вместе с ними были помощники.

Tsez_Line: Sid bazarganes xexbi zownanu.
English_Translation: One merchant had no child.
Russian_Translation: У одного купца не было детей.

Tsez_Line: Bayn yizirabi ƛirbałix sid žek’ude idur.
English_Translation: Then came home to a man as guests.
Russian_Translation: Они пришли в гости домой к одному человеку.

Tsez_Line: Elo idu besun iłno užin, mežä k’ʷač’nox yiziräsi ɣˤanabin.
English_Translation: There at home they found six sons and in the bed a groaning woman.
Russian_Translation: Там дома нашел шестеро мальчика и в постели стенающую женщину.

Tsez_Line: Xexbi anuru bazarganƛ’o ci Žungutaw zown.
English_Translation: The name of the merchant who had no children was Jungutav.
Russian_Translation: Звали купца у которого не было детей Жунгутав.

Tsez_Line: Nesä ƛirbaq esirno, yedu ɣˤanabi šida qˤaƛanayx ʕiyayxƛin.
English_Translation: He asked the guest: "Why is this woman yelling and crying?"
Russian_Translation: Он у гостя спросил, почему эта женщина громко плачет мол.

Tsez_Line: Xedya žawab teƛno, neła xexbi rodixƛin.
English_Translation: The husband answered: "She is giving birth to a child."
Russian_Translation: Муж ответил, что она рожает ребенка.

Tsez_Line: Žungutawä eƛin, yedu xexbi där neƛnäy, deber di ʕuraw ukru-micxirno, xexzargon šeƛ’u-bˤoƛ’on neƛanƛin.
English_Translation: Jungutav said: "If you give me this child, I will give you a lot of gold and silver, and clothes for the children."
Russian_Translation: Жунгутав сказал, если ты мне дашь этого ребенка, я тебе дам много драгоценности и одежду для детей.

Tsez_Line: Mi äƛiruxor ričiƛƛin, razi oqno neł ɣˤutkos bet’erhan.
English_Translation: "May it be as you said!", agreed the master of that house.
Russian_Translation: Пусть будет так, как ты сказал, мол согласился хозяин дома.

Tsez_Line: Neł ɣˤanazar uži odin.
English_Translation: A son was born to the woman.
Russian_Translation: Та женщина родила мальчика.

Tsez_Line: Sasaqosi kikin xirerno, keze boqxosi ƛirbar ukru-micxirno teƛno, Žungutawä žan ižin.
English_Translation: In the morning, [she] nursed [him], and Jungutav came and gave the guest gold and silver and took the child.
Russian_Translation: Утром кормили грудью, гостью полагающиеся драгоценности дали и Жунгутав забрал его.

Tsez_Line: Kumak-xalq’in sadaq boɣno bazarganbi hunix boqno.
English_Translation: Together with their assistants, the merchants went on their way.
Russian_Translation: Вместе с помощниками купцы отправились в путь.

Tsez_Line: Ciqqor baynosi, užä ʕiyada bašla bodin.
English_Translation: When they came to a forest, the boy began to cry.
Russian_Translation: Когда дошли до леса, мальчик начал плакать.

Tsez_Line: Didurnotow nesiq guru bičirerłinč’izaƛ’, Žungutawä uži sidaɣ ciqqo ɣunoƛ uqˤanir kumak-xalq’i begirno.
English_Translation: Because they couldn't stop his crying, Jungutav sent his assistants to hide him under a tree.
Russian_Translation: Никак не смог он остановить плачь и Жунгутав отправил помощников, чтобы укрыть мальчика под одним деревом.

Tsez_Line: Žeda ža sidaɣ łˤebozał ƛ’iriɣor hut’-mˤalin roƛik’no uqˤno.
English_Translation: They hid him somewhere with only his face out of the leaves.
Russian_Translation: Они его укрыли в одном месте под листьями с открытым лицом.

Tsez_Line: Elo igoza ciqqo ečrut’ani xalq’imos qunno, beƛ’ˤes reqenno zown, amma žedus xexbi zownanu.
English_Translation: In the neighboring forest, there was some old people's farmstead with a heard of sheep, but they didn't have a child.
Russian_Translation: Там вблизи у стариков был хутор и отара овец, но у них не было детей.

Tsez_Line: Qunyox yałru bežet’anizaz beƛ’ˤes reqenyoł sis čanya zown q’ˤano cek’i bodäsi.
English_Translation: The oldest one, who was on the farmstead, had a goat in his herd which gave birth to two goat kids.
Russian_Translation: У стариков, живущих на хуторе, в отаре овец была одна коза, которая родила двух козлят.

Tsez_Line: Zamanałäy čanyan, cek’bintow ħalaq’ roqa roqno.
English_Translation: After a while, the she-goat and the goat kids began to become meager.
Russian_Translation: Через некоторое время коза и козлята начали истощаться.

Tsez_Line: Ža čanya nar eƛa biynč’ey reqenyołäy gugixt’a zown.
English_Translation: The she-goat didn't know what to do anymore and escaped from the herd.
Russian_Translation: Эта коза из отары не зная куда регулярно исчезала.

Tsez_Line: Aħozä c’aq’ xal bodin zown, nar ža čanya gugixƛin.
English_Translation: The shepherd examined closely, where this goat escaped to.
Russian_Translation: Пастух хорошенько следил, куда же исчезает эта коза.

Tsez_Line: Xizaz aħo nexxo ukayrun, čanya ozƛäy bok’ełxo zown.
English_Translation: Seeing the shepherd coming from behind, the goat escaped from his eye.
Russian_Translation: Видя идущего сзади пастуха, коза терялась с глаз неизвестно куда.

Tsez_Line: Hudun, xizaɣor aħozä biyrno čanya bik’ixosi moči.
English_Translation: Nevertheless the shepherd finally found out the place where the goat went to.
Russian_Translation: Тем не менее, в конце концов пастух узнал место, куда шла коза.

Tsez_Line: Neła ɣˤay xirerxo zown bazarganä ciqqo eqäruni žaq.
English_Translation: It was giving milk to the boy who was put into the forest by the merchants.
Russian_Translation: Она кормила молоком мальчика, которого оставили в лесу купцы.

Tsez_Line: Bik’in ečrut’ani xalq’in łˤebozałäyn oɣno ža uži iduɣor own.
English_Translation: The old people went, took the boy out of the leaves and brought him home.
Russian_Translation: Пошли старики извлекли из-под листьев мальчика и привели домой.

Tsez_Line: Bežet’anibi ʕurawtow ɣˤaɣˤun bizin, nesiƛ’ Tabuldiƛin cin erno.
English_Translation: The oldest ones were very glad and gave him the name Tabuldi.
Russian_Translation: Старики очень обрадовались и дали ему имя Табулди.

Tsez_Line: Ža uži esarus aħozir ixiw sayɣatno bodin, egirno xizor.
English_Translation: The boy gave the shepherds who had found him a big present and sent them back.
Russian_Translation: За то, что нашел мальчика, пастуху сделал большой подарок и отправили его назад.

Tsez_Line: Ečrut’anibin, Tabuldin sis haq’u biłe ciqqo bercinaw t’abiʕatyoł ʕumrun, maʕišatno bodix bičin.
English_Translation: The old people and Tabuldi lived together like a family in the forest and lead a beautiful life in the nature and made a fortune.
Russian_Translation: Старики и Табулди как одна семья жили красиво среди природы и вели хозяйство.

Tsez_Line: Žaqˤułno esix žedu elo yołƛin.
English_Translation: It is said that they are still there today.
Russian_Translation: Сегодня тоже рассказывают, что они там живут.

Tsez_Line: Sis zown eni-babiwn, žedusgon sistow sis užin.
English_Translation: There was a couple and they had only one son.
Russian_Translation: Были одни мат-отец, у них был один сын.

Tsez_Line: Žedu qunyox bičix zown.
English_Translation: They were living on a farm.
Russian_Translation: Они жили на хуторе.

Tsez_Line: Eni-babiya ža uži sasaqno, neširun bˤeƛ’xay oɣxo zownanu.
English_Translation: In the morning and in the evening, the parents didn't let him away from the sheep.
Russian_Translation: Утром и вечером родители оставили его пасти овец.

Tsez_Line: Sida quł mužmarƛ’o purqo taqˤo-naqˤor babiwr sisxoli bˤeƛ’ gurow raħnayx rukaynanu.
English_Translation: One day on Friday, the father saw only the sheep there walking alone hither and thither through the field.
Russian_Translation: Однажды в пятницу отец увидел на склоне только овец, которые ходили туда-сюда.

Tsez_Line: Mužmares kakno rodin, narey yeda uži ok’łä bˤeƛ’däyƛin, eza ik’izaƛ’, req’ezin oqno kecäsi esun.
English_Translation: He did the Friday's prayer, and went to see where his son went to from the flock of sheep, and when he approached him, he found him asleep.
Russian_Translation: После пятничной молитвы, когда отец пошел посмотреть, куда же мол этот сын ушел от овец, нашел спокойно спящим.

Tsez_Line: Igorno ik’in babiya č’arik’nosi, užir retinanu, dahawgon šida di moƛał xecinč’uƛin.
English_Translation: The father came closer and after waking him up, the son didn't like it [and said]: "Why didn't you let me sleep a little more?"
Russian_Translation: Подошел поближе и отец разбудил, сыну не понравилось, почему чуть-чуть еще во сне меня не оставил мол.

Tsez_Line: Howlotow babiw hemece ƛ’iri utin žaƛ’ šida mi ža eƛä, šebi deber moƛał rukayx zowäƛin.
English_Translation: Then the father replied to the son: "Why do you say this, what did you see in your dream?"
Russian_Translation: Тут же отец столько настаивал сына, почему ты это сказал, что ты увидел во сне мол.

Tsez_Line: Esinč’inäy bazarganzar teƛa yołƛin ʕuƛ’erxo zown.
English_Translation: "If you don't tell, I will sell you to the merchants!", he scared him.
Russian_Translation: Если не расскажешь, то отдам купцам мол, пугал.

Tsez_Line: Užä ot’ bisno ičin, mi šebigon rodiłin äsinč’iƛin.
English_Translation: The son was rejecting, "Whatever you do, I won't tell."
Russian_Translation: Сын отказался, что бы ты не сделаешь, все равно не расскажу мол.

Tsez_Line: Elay nesä ik’in baruq raqru łinałäyn esinosi, neła eƛin, neširu t’ekan bexʷad, užin goƛ’o, xizyo di nesiq esiranƛin.
English_Translation: He went away and told his wife what had happened, and she said: "Slaughter a goat tonight, call the boy and afterwards I will ask him."
Russian_Translation: Оттуда пошел он, рассказал жене и она сказал, вечером зарежь козла, пригласи сына и потом я спрошу у него.

Tsez_Line: Bexʷayn t’ekan, ƛoħaɣor nełas reƛno riħurno, goƛ’in uži.
English_Translation: So he slaughtered the goat, put its meat into a pan and called his son.
Russian_Translation: Зарезал козла, закинули в кастрюлю его мясо и пригласили сына.

Tsez_Line: T’ogon žade puħorno yik’in, ƛ’iri yutin eniw, eso däq, šebi deber moƛał rukayx zowäƛin.
English_Translation: There, the mother went beside him and insisted: "Tell me, what did you see in your dream?"
Russian_Translation: Тут мама подошла ближе к сыну, настояла, расскажи мне, что ты видел во сне мол.

Tsez_Line: Eniwqorno hemedurtow, esa k’ʷeze yaqinč’i däqƛin ičin.
English_Translation: To his mother he was the same: "I cannot tell you."
Russian_Translation: Маме тоже также сказал, не могу я рассказать мол.

Tsez_Line: Xizyo, babiya äƛiruxor, ža uži bazarganzar teƛno.
English_Translation: Afterwards, the father sold his boy off to the merchants, as he said.
Russian_Translation: Потом, как сказал отец, того сына дал купцам.

Tsez_Line: ƛ’iri xabar boynč’ey bazarganzadetow sadaq oqno užin ik’in.
English_Translation: Without further conversation, the boy went together with the merchants.
Russian_Translation: Без лишнего разговора вместе с купцами и мальчик пошел.

Tsez_Line: Hunix bik’iƛ’oräy, sasiłnosi yizi nasin sidaɣ łin, c’in, qacan anuza gogaƛ’ rešt’izi boqno.
English_Translation: While they were on their way, it got dark and they all took a rest on a meadow without any firewood, fire or water.
Russian_Translation: Идя по дороге, когда стемнело они остановились на одном поле, где не было ни воды, ни огня, ни дров.

Tsez_Line: Boč’ik’xo, ačqˤayx, bazarganbi butnozaxarno butin kecno bičin.
English_Translation: Feeling cold and being thirsty, the merchants wrapped themselves into their burkas and fell asleep.
Russian_Translation: Озябшие и жаждущие купцы завернулись в бурки и легли спать.

Tsez_Line: Yisi žar moƛał neł gogaƛäz łäs oreznin, bišʷan rizäsi c’in, qacisgon ɣeryabin rukayn.
English_Translation: In his dream, the boy saw a pond of water under the meadow, food, a fire and a pile of firewood.
Russian_Translation: Это мальчик видел во сне ниже поля озерцо воды, еду, воспламенившего огня и штабель дров.

Tsez_Line: Eloš gogaƛäz łin yoł, eräsigon c’in yoł, ƛ’irigon ħažat roqnäy qacan yołƛin nesä neside puħosi bazargan č’arik’nosi, nediw oqzaƛ’ła min eni-babiya elur neƛäƛin, uyƛag aƛ’in.
English_Translation: "Over there, behind the field is water, and there is a fire and firewood, if necessary!", [he said] and when woke up the merchant next to him, he really scolded: "Because you're like this, your parents have given you to us!"
Russian_Translation: Там за полем находится вода, зажженный огонь, если понадобится и дрова мол, разбудил рядом находящегося купца. А он наоборот поругал (сказал иронией), мол поэтому родители дали тебя  нам, из-за того, что ты такой.

Tsez_Line: Sidenigon bazarganqor č’arik’no hemedurtow eƛin butnoƛäzay ezunosi, c’idos lapi bukayn.
English_Translation: He woke up another merchant and told him so, and when he looked out of his burka, he saw the flare of a fire.
Russian_Translation: Разбудил и также сказал другому купцу. Посмотрел из-под бурки и увидел пламя огня.

Tsez_Line: Nesä sadaq bazarganbin č’arik’no, c’idoxaɣor bik’inosi, elogon łäs kikno besun, bišʷan resun.
English_Translation: He woke up all the merchants and they went to the fire, where they found a spring of water and food.
Russian_Translation: Он разбудил всех купцов, пошли к огню, там нашли источника воды и еду.

Tsez_Line: Bišno axbin royn q’ˤida bičinosi, bazarganza esirno žaq, nediw oqzaƛ’gon šida mi eni-babiya elur neƛäƛin.
English_Translation: After they sat down and ate their bellies full(?), the merchants asked the boy: "Although you are like this, why did your parents give you to us?"
Russian_Translation: После того, как покушали и сидели наевшие, купцы спросили у мальчика, хотя ты такой, почему родители дали нам тебя мол.

Tsez_Line: Di žeduqƛin, žawab teƛno nesä, där bˤeƛ’xo yałzay yukayru moƛu esinč’uƛin.
English_Translation: He answered "I didn't tell them what I dreamed of while herding the sheep."
Russian_Translation: Он ответил, я им не рассказал сон, который видел находясь пастухом овец.

Tsez_Line: Howža yisiq eƛin rok’äłrungon žedu yisiƛ’or butin, eluqgon esinč’inäy, ela mi xaner teƛa yołƛin.
English_Translation: When he had said that to him, they insisted: "When you don't tell us, we will give you to the king."
Russian_Translation: Как только это он сказал, они настаивали его, если нам тоже не расскажешь, мы тебя дадим царю.

Tsez_Line: Meža šebigon rodiłin, däz di eni-babiwqkin äsinč’iru, mežuq yežigon di ža moƛu äsinč’iƛin, uži et’un k’oƛin ičin.
English_Translation: "Whatever you do, I won't tell you my dream that I wouldn't tell my parents either!", the boy [said and] ran away.
Russian_Translation: Мальчик был решительным, когда я не рассказал своим родителям, вам тем более не расскажу, что бы вы ни сделали мол.

Tsez_Line: Xizyo žedagon ža ižin xaner teƛno.
English_Translation: Afterwards they brought and gave him to the king.
Russian_Translation: Потом они его повели и дали царю.

Tsez_Line: Nesä ža mat’izaxor egirno.
English_Translation: He let him look after the ducks.
Russian_Translation: Он его пустил ухаживать за утки.

Tsez_Line: Xanes zown sis bercinaw kid.
English_Translation: The king had one beautiful daughter.
Russian_Translation: У царя была одна красивая дочь.

Tsez_Line: Zamanałäy žedus žeduqor roƛ’i boqno.
English_Translation: After a while, they fell in love with each other.
Russian_Translation: Через некоторое время они влюбились друг в друга.

Tsez_Line: Kidbä yik’in mat’izaxay oɣo žaƛin babiwqor eƛinosi, nesä inkar bodin, eläy oɣłin nełƛ’ay bigza mečoƛ’or di ža egärinč’iƛin.
English_Translation: When the daughter went and told her father: "Let him away from the ducks!", he rejected and said: "I won't let him to a place better than this one."
Russian_Translation: Дочь пошла и сказала отцу, освободи его от ухода за утками, но он отказался, все равно я его не пущу на более, чем это, хорошее место.

Tsez_Line: Žeduł roƛosi šebin čuqˤnosi, xanä wazirzaqorno eƛin uži tełer kurerno.
English_Translation: When he noticed what is between them, the king told his viziers to throw the boy into jail.
Russian_Translation: Когда заметил их взаимоотношение, царь сказал визирам и юношу посадили в тюрьму.

Tsez_Line: Ža xanzo kidber ʕuraw isałno, k’eneč’cet’a gurow yišxo zownanu.
English_Translation: This was very difficult for the king's daughter, and she didn't eat anything but food in the size of an egg anymore.
Russian_Translation: Дочь царя переносила это очень тяжело, она ела пищу размером яйца.

Tsez_Line: Hemecegon där neƛxosi bišʷa raq’ˤik’ƛin babiwqorno eƛin, ƛäxuru neła nazonoqayn ruqˤno tusnaq’är užir rižixt’a yik’ix zown.
English_Translation: "Increase the food that you are giving to me!", she said to her father, ...
Russian_Translation: Столько еще пищу, дающую мне увеличь сказала папе и оставшуюся она тайно ото всех отнесла юноше в тюрьму.

Tsez_Line: Sida zamanał, maduhalłiqozo ħukmatyoz xanä yisiƛ’or begirno geres hibo bayrno naza boq’ˤiw, naza kikiw yałru biyrƛin.
English_Translation: At one point in time, the king of a neighboring country sent to him an iron stick [with the message]: "Find out where it's heavy and where's it's light."
Russian_Translation: В одно время царь из соседнего государства отправил к нему железную палку, узнай откуда легкая, откуда тяжелая мол.

Tsez_Line: Nagaħ ža riyrinč’inäy dowde dandir di ƛˤori boda yołƛin.
English_Translation: "If you don't find it out, I will start a war against you."
Russian_Translation: Если ты не узнаешь об этом, я объявлю войну против тебя.

Tsez_Line: Xanä q’ʷaridno oqno wˤałer rˤoƛ’arzay q’ˤimkin rizirxo zownanu, t’ok’ow roda šebin koƛ’inč’ey.
English_Translation: The king became sad and while he hung his head, he didn't lift it up again and didn't know what to do anymore.
Russian_Translation: Царь огорчился, не зная что делать, не поднимал даже голову, опущенную вниз.

Tsez_Line: Sida quł tusnaq’är žader q’ʷaridno yoqno xanes kid yayn, šebi roqnoƛin nesä bayan bisnosi, yiłä nełäz babiwƛ’or bayru q’ʷariłiłäy esin.
English_Translation: One day, the sad princess came to the boy into the prison and when he wanted to know what had happened, she told about the sadness that came upon her father.
Russian_Translation: В один день к юноше в тюрьму опечаленная пришла дочь царя. Когда уточнил он, что случилось мол, она рассказала о том, какое горе настигло ее отца.

Tsez_Line: Nełaq mi rasgi q’ʷarid yaqnoƛin, žoyä nełas rok’u čučzi royn.
English_Translation: "Don't be sad at all about it!", he calmed her down.
Russian_Translation: Ты нисколько не грусти за это мол, юноша успокаивал ее.

Tsez_Line: Howt’ay yäk’irun, där moƛał rukaysƛin babiwqor eƛo mi, soderno kurno ƛ’ˤiyor nexƛ’oräy, geres hibos boq’ˤugani pu wˤałxor butin nexno raƛ’moƛxorgon šäšiƛin.
English_Translation: "When you go again, tell your father that you have seen it in a dream: He shall throw it upward and when it comes down again, the iron stick's heavier side will turn downward and get stuck in the earth."
Russian_Translation: Как придешь отсюда, скажи отцу мол, что ты видела во сне, если железную палку бросить на верх и когда опуститься вниз, то тяжелая часть повернется книзу, даже может вонзиться в землю.

Tsez_Line: Elayn k’oƛin yik’in neła hemedur där moƛał rukaysƛin, užä małiru šebin babiwq esin.
English_Translation: So she ran away and told her father: "I have seem it in a dream!" and what the boy had explained to her.

Tsez_Line: Xanä cuƛerno kurno boq’ˤugani puƛ’aza ža hibo raƛ’moƛxor šišinosi, kaɣatno caxno ent’aza boq’ˤiw, ent’aza kikiw yoł yedu hiboƛin xizo-q’ˤimer maduhalłiqozo xander begirno.
English_Translation: The king threw the stick into the air and it got stuck in the earth with the heavy side, then he wrote a letter writing where the stick is heavy and where it is light, and sent the stick back to the king from the neighboring country.

Tsez_Line: Xizyogon hemesitow xanä begirno q’ˤano t’umi bayrno, howzałäy nasi guluči, nasi aqiw yałru biyrƛin.
English_Translation: Then, that king had two pigeons be brought[ to him, saying]: "Find out, which is male and which is female!"

Tsez_Line: Žigon xan q’ʷariłiłer egin.
English_Translation: Again, the king was sad.

Tsez_Line: K’oƛin yik’in žader kid ixiwt’a muši kurxo yičin.
English_Translation: His daughter came running and moaned heavily at the boy.

Tsez_Line: Šebi roqno deber, tusnaq’ä yałru dikinwa necet’a ixiw muši kurxanuƛin, žoyä bayan bisnosi, neła hemedur q’ˤano t’umi bayräsi yoł, žedałäy nasi guluči, nasi aqiw bat’a boda koƛ’inč’ey ƛexasiƛin esin.
English_Translation: "What happened to you? Even I, who I am in prison, don't moan so much!", the boy wanted to know, and she told him so: "Two pigeons were brought and it remains unknown how to distinguish which of them is male and which is female!"

Tsez_Line: Q’ʷarid boqa bayxozoce šebin anu žaƛin, kidbes žoyä rok’u ɣˤaɣˤu rizirno.
English_Translation: "There is nothing to be sad about", the boy made the girl's heart happy.

Tsez_Line: Howt’ay yäk’irun moƛał rukays därƛin eso nesiq, łˤora ɣudƛ’o q’ˤanon t’umibi quqan xecin žedar biša kurnosi, gulučini t’umi šet’u butix bäči, aqugani bišno łiyaceƛin.
English_Translation: "When you go out, - I saw it in a dream -", he told him(?), "leave the two pigeons hungry for 3 days, then, after you throw food onto them, the male pigeon will turn around until the female pigeon has finished eating."

Tsez_Line: Elay babiwderno yik’in, užä małiruxor, hemedurtow där moƛał rukaysƛin, neła esin.
English_Translation: She went out and to her father, and told him, after what the boy had explained: "I saw it like this in a dream!"

Tsez_Line: Xanä žedu t’umbi łˤora ɣudi quqan xecin rišerƛ’oräy, aqugani bišno łiyace gulučini t’umi šet’u butix bičin.
English_Translation: The king left those pigeons hungry for three days, and when he fed them, the male one turned around until the female one had finished eating.

Tsez_Line: Xizyo gulučinin bišno.
English_Translation: Afterwards the male one ate as well.

Tsez_Line: Nasi žedałäy guluči, nasi aqiw yałru biynosi, maduhalłiqozo xanƛ’or kaɣatno caxno, enda guluči, enda aqiwƛin nesiƛ’or hoz-hozu t’uman regirno.
English_Translation: After he knew which of them is the male and which is the female one, he wrote a letter to the neighboring king, and sent the pigeons back seperately [indicating] on it "That one is male" and "That one is female".

Tsez_Line: Hudayƛ’aygon maduhalłiqozoni xanä begirno q’ˤano gulu bayrno nasi yizałäy ʕoloqanaw, nasi ečru yałru bat’a boda koƛ’inč’inäy, di dowde dandir ƛˤori boda yołƛin.
English_Translation: On the next day, the neighboring king had two horses be brought to him, [saying:] "If you don't know how to find out which of them is young and which is old, I will make war on you!"

Tsez_Line: Xanƛ’o reže ɣudi zown, roda šebin koƛ’inč’ey.
English_Translation: It was a big hazzle for the king and he didn't know what to do.

Tsez_Line: Babiwƛ’ nediw ɣudi rukayzaƛ’, kid žigon yizin žader tusnaq’ärno yik’in akixor yaynosi, ixiw muši kurno.
English_Translation: When she saw the hazzle on her father, the girl got up again and went into the prison to the boy, and moaned, when she came to the window.

Tsez_Line: Žigon šebi roqnoƛin, užä bayan bisnosi, neła kinaw raqru šebin esin.
English_Translation: When the boy asked: "What happened?" again, she told all the things that happened.

Tsez_Line: Mi q’ʷarid yaqnoƛin, eƛin užä.
English_Translation: "Don't be sad!", said the boy.

Tsez_Line: Howt’ay yäk’irun mi babiwqor där moƛał rukaysƛin eƛo, łˤora ɣudi žedu gulubi rišerłin, łi ħaƛurinč’eyn xecin, iħä łäƛ’or žedu rižinosi, ʕoloqanawni gulu łi ħaƛa boƛƛäɣor bäk’i, ečrunä lilyoxaytow ħaƛuƛin.
English_Translation: "When you go, say to your father that I saw it in a dream: Although you feed those horses for three days, you don't give them water to drink, then you lead them over the water into a river; the young horse will go to the middle to drink water, the old one will drink from the riverbank instead."

Tsez_Line: Elay yik’in kidbä, där hemedur moƛu yukaysƛin, babiwqor nesi užä äsiru łinałäyn eƛin.
English_Translation: The girl went away and [saying] "I had a dream like this!", told to her father about what that boy had told.

Tsez_Line: Xanä žedu gulubi łˤora ɣudi łi teƛinč’eyn rišerno łäƛ’or regirnosi, ʕoloqanawni gulu boƛƛäɣor bik’in, ečrunä lilyoxaytow ħaƛun neł qułtow žedu xizorno regirno, enda ečru, enda ʕoloqanaw yołƛin kaɣatno caxno.
English_Translation: The king didn't give these horses water, but fed them for three days, then he let them onto the water and the young horse went into the middle and the old one drank from the riverbank; on that day, he sent them back, writing a letter[ stating]: "This one is old.", "This one is young."

Tsez_Line: Łˤono nesił adäza erno zawruni masala t’ubazi bodinosi, yeda xan askarno bižin nesi xanƛ’o iħanadanix ik’in.
English_Translation: Having fulfilled the three tasks that were put before him, the other king led an army against this king to go fighting.

Tsez_Line: Žedu elozay bok’äłrungon, xanez kidbä k’oƛin yik’in tusnaq’ay maħor uži egirno.
English_Translation: They escaped from there and the king's daughter ran and let the boy out of the prison.

Tsez_Line: Tełäy aqrun, nesä šeƛ’un xiszi rodin, sis ganin biqirno, ozyoł xizay oqno.
English_Translation: Having gotten out, he changed clothes, took a bull-calf and got behind the army.

Tsez_Line: Ganƛ’on zown neširur yiził xizay yik’in, raładyoł taqˤorno boqa biynč’ey sidaɣ gogaƛ’ rešt’izi boqäsi besun.
English_Translation: And on the bull-calf, he went behind them in the evening and found them taking a rest on a meadow somewhere, not knowing how to get over the sea.

Tsez_Line: Neširu xanä elo nasin sidaɣor butirnosi, xanä eƛin, di łi ħaƛuxosi t’akan sasaqor howt’or yayäru žek’ux kid yegira yołƛin.
English_Translation: In the evening the king gather everyone together and said: "I will marry my daughter off to the man who can bring my water-drinking-glass here tomorrow!"

Tsez_Line: Ža täqrun, ganƛ’on zown ik’in zawruni uži t’umin boqno, bik’in xanzo kidbez akix heqno.
English_Translation: Having heard this, the boy, who was riding on the bull-calf, turned into a pigeon, flew away and sat down on the princess' window.

Tsez_Line: Nełagon eniwqay izmun bisno, ža t’umi bexurač’inƛin nełqay rožin riqirno, akin raɣˤin tełxor begärun, bik’in kidbez q’ˤimƛ’o heqno.
English_Translation: It [the pigeon] asked permission from the mother and took her word that she would never kill this pigeon; she opened the window and let it inside, and it flew in and sat down on the girl's head.

Tsez_Line: Biqiranƛin neła reƛ’a regirnosigon, boxin elay ƛexeƛzo girimoƛ’no heqno žek’-bok’ełno mesedyos ħuli q’ˤidar bˤoƛ’urno.
English_Translation: She tried to remove it with her hand and it flew away, sat down on a pole under a log, shook itself and made a golden feather fall down.

Tsez_Line: Kidbägon elayn bisno neła nełaz pardagix bicin.
English_Translation: The girl then went and took it and tied it to her own scarf.

Tsez_Line: Xizyogon žek’-bok’ełnosi, nełłäy ukrus his yołäsi miƛ’i boqno.
English_Translation: Then it shook itself again and he became a ram with silver whool.

Tsez_Line: Miƛ’igon žek’-bok’ełno q’ˤidar his rˤoƛ’unosi, žan kidbä risno pardagix rutirno.
English_Translation: The ram then shook itself and a piece of whool fell down; the girl took it and attached it to the scarf.

Tsez_Line: K’ox äƛirugon žek’-bok’ełnosi, užiƛ’or butin.
English_Translation: When it shook itself a second time, it turned into the boy.

Tsez_Line: Xizyo nesä kinaw raqru šebinon esin, xaner nesäq nesä łi ħaƛuxosini t’akan yetinƛin esirno.
English_Translation: Afterwards, he told everything that happened and the king asked for the water-drinking-glass that he wanted.

Tsez_Line: Kidbä yisno mesedyosni t’akan teƛno.
English_Translation: The girl took the golden glass and gave it to him.

Tsez_Line: Žałäy t’umin boqno, kidbägon akin raɣˤin begirno.
English_Translation: The boy became a pigeon again, and the girl opened the window and let it out.

Tsez_Line: Neł t’umä ža t’akan yižin xaneł purłäzan eqerno, elaygon bitor hawaƛ’ žedu biħada bik’ixozo xanzo akixor bik’in.
English_Translation: The pigeon carried this glass, put it next to the king and from there flew to the king's window, from which they went out to fight.
Russian_Translation: Этот голубь отвез тот стакан, поставил около царя, оттуда дальше пошел к окну царя, к которому они идут воевать.

Tsez_Line: Elor baynosi, č’ikin boqno c’aramäz begin iduɣorno bik’in, žedus xabarno teqerno bičin.
English_Translation: When it arrived there, it became a flea, went inside through a crack and listened to what they said.
Russian_Translation: Пришел туда, превратился в блоху, прошел через щель домой и слушал их разговор.

Tsez_Line: Bara xanqor hoboy eluƛ’or oz nexxowaƛin eƛinosi, nesä eƛin, nexłin žedur huni räynč’i.
English_Translation: When the kings wife asked the king: "Is the army coming towards us now?", he said: "Although they will come, they won't know the way.
Russian_Translation: Когда жена сказала, теперь войско идет на нас мол, он проговорил, хотя придут они дорогу не узнают.

Tsez_Line: Huni yoł ganƛ’on zown uži näxzaz regin.
English_Translation: The way is going where the boy on the bull came from.
Russian_Translation: Дорога идет с той стороны, откуда шел юноша на быке.

Tsez_Line: Hunin resun žedu nexłin, sadaq mesed gogaƛ’orno boɣno čuret’no bok’no nełas di nˤoƛu yadi.
English_Translation: And even if they come, when they find the way, I will take away all the gold onto a meadow and with the beat of my whip, I'll transform it into ashes.
Russian_Translation: Хотя они найдут дорогу и придут, все золото вынесу на поле и ударом плетью я его превращу в золу.

Tsez_Line: Xizyogon kidbezno, debezno, däzno čuret’no bok’no, ħolaq’awt’a ʕomoybin rodin, ža čuret’ nˤoƛał buqˤan łärnokin bäsunč’iza.
English_Translation: Then with the beats of our daughter's, your and my whip, we will turn into thin donkeys and hide the whip in the ashes where no one can find it.
Russian_Translation: Затем ударом плетью оберну дочери, тебя и себя в худощавых ослов и эту плеть спрячу в золе, где никто не найдет.

Tsez_Line: Xanes č’ortobi rukaynosi, xizo-q’ˤimer butin žedun bäk’iƛin.
English_Translation: And when they see the king's clothes, they will go back again."
Russian_Translation: Увидев тряпки царя, они тоже обратно пойдут.

Tsez_Line: Žeduq bexurno xabar łiynosi, c’aramałäz begin ža č’iki maħorno boqno, t’umƛ’orno butin boržizin boqno bik’in.
English_Translation: After they finished talking, the flea went outside through a crack, turned into a pigeon again and flew away.
Russian_Translation: Как они закончили этот разговор, сквозь щель прошла блоха, превратилась в голубя, и полетел.

Tsez_Line: Gogaƛ’or baynosi, užiƛ’orno butin, ik’in ozyode sadaq kecno ičin.
English_Translation: When it arrived at the meadow, it became the boy again and went to sleep next to the army.
Russian_Translation: Когда прилетел на поле, превратился в юношу, пошел и лег спать вместе с войском.

Tsez_Line: Xanes wazir č’ariłno puħo t’akan yukaynosi, nesis cim bizin, łu yedu mesedyos t’akan t’or yayrnoƛin.
English_Translation: When the king's vizier woke up and saw the glass at his side, he became angry[ and asked]: "Who brought this golden glass here?"
Russian_Translation: Увидев рядом стакан, визирь царя проснулся и разозлился, кто этот стакан доставил сюда мол.

Tsez_Line: Elayn izin t’akanno yisno, et’un guluƛ’orno k’oƛin, elar bižin, t’ar bižin bigza ħalał žan akik’no, xizyo yižin xande t’akanno eqerno.
English_Translation: He got up from there, took the glass and jumped onto a horse, lead it here and there, which tired him quite much, and then he carried the glass back and put it next to the king.
Russian_Translation: Оттуда встал, взял стакан, выпрыгнул на коня, туда повел, сюда повел, изрядно замотал его, потом отнес и поставил стакан возле царя.

Tsez_Line: Moƛaxay izinosi, xan ħayran oqno ƛexun puħo t’akan yukaynosi.
English_Translation: When the king got up from sleeping, he was surprised when he saw the glass at his side.
Russian_Translation: Царь встал и удивился, когда увидел возле себя стакан.

Tsez_Line: Žeduq neł gogaƛ’or baynč’ey łˤono bucin, łˤono ɣudin, łˤono saʕatno rik’äsi zown.
English_Translation: They didn't come to that meadow for three months, three days and three hours.

Tsez_Line: Yedu t’akan łu t’or yayräƛin nesä bayan bisnosi, oƛixno k’oƛin nesistow wazirä di yowsƛin eƛin.
English_Translation: When he wanted to know: "Who brought this glass here?", his vizier came running and said: "I brought it!"
Russian_Translation: Когда он уточнял, мол, кто доставил этот стакан, появился его же визирь и сказал, я принес мол.

Tsez_Line: Nedur resunäyƛin, utin nesiƛ’ar xan debex di kid yegira yoł, amma ža t’akan mi yayrno yesunč’inäy, debi di meč’ beč’a yołƛin.
English_Translation: "If that's the case", the king turned to him, "I will marry my daughter off to you, but if it's not the case that you brought the glass, I will cut off your head."
Russian_Translation: Если так, повернулся царь в его сторону, я выдам за тебя дочь, но если не ты принес этот стакан, я отрублю твою голову мол.

Tsez_Line: Sasaq bizinosi, ža uži ganƛ’on zown hunix oqno.
English_Translation: The next morning, when he got up, the boy got on his way riding on the bull.
Russian_Translation: Когда встали утром, тот юноша сел на быка и отправился в путь.

Tsez_Line: Wazirzagon ozno boɣno nesił xizay bik’anƛin.
English_Translation: The viziers led the army out and went to follow him.
Russian_Translation: Визири подняли войско и пошли за ним.

Tsez_Line: T’azay nexxo oz rukaynosi, nesi xanä sadaq ukru-micxirno gogaƛ’or boɣno, čuret’no bok’no nˤoƛu yodin.
English_Translation: When he saw that the army was coming from there, the king took away all his gold and silver onto the meadow, cracked his whip and turned it into ashes.
Russian_Translation: Царь увидел, что отсюда идет войско, и вынес на поле все драгоценности, ударил плеть и превратил в золу.

Tsez_Line: Kidbezno, baruzno, nesizno bok’nosigon, žedułäy ħalaq’awt’a ʕomoybi roqno.
English_Translation: And after cracking also [for?] his daughter, his wife and himself, they became thin donkeys.
Russian_Translation: Затем ударил дочери, жену, себя и превратил в худощавых ослов.

Tsez_Line: Ža čuret’no nˤoƛał buqˤno.
English_Translation: The whip he hid in the ashes.
Russian_Translation: Эту плеть спрятал в золе.

Tsez_Line: Elor bayrun xanes oz partalq’ay butiranił c’oxno.
English_Translation: When the king's army arrived there, they started gathering the belongings.
Russian_Translation: Как пришли туда, царское войско приступило к сбору имущества.

Tsez_Line: Nesi užä yołi nˤoƛas ixinabi ric’no, ʕomoyƛ’no erno hunix oqno, dicegon žedu, ža nˤoƛugon łinar yižixƛin, nesiqor baƛ’ix bičiłin.
English_Translation: The boy however filled his bags with ashes, put them onto the donkey and went on his way, although they were scolding him much: "Why are you carrying these ashes?!"
Russian_Translation: А этот юноша заполнил мешки золы, поставил их на ослов и шел по дороге, хотя они ругали его, зачем эту золу хоть забрать мол.

Tsez_Line: Xanän, nesis ozyon bisno bäziruce nesi xanes maʕišatno bown, xizo-q’ˤimer butin ʕaƛaɣor žedun nexno.
English_Translation: The [other] king and his army took as much as they could get of this king's belongings and returned back into the village.
Russian_Translation: Царь и его войско взяли с собой имущество того царя столько, сколько смогли, и вернулись обратно в село.

Tsez_Line: Elogon xanä wazirbin butirno, sosigon łu yedu dey mesedyosni t’akan yayräƛin esirnosi, oƛixno hemesitow wazirä eƛin, di yayrinč’a žaƛin.
English_Translation: There, the king gathered his viziers, and when he asked: "Who again brought this golden glass of mine?", that vizier appeared and said: "Haven't I brought it?"
Russian_Translation: Там тоже царь собрал визиров, еще раз спросил, кто привел этот мой золотой стакан мол, появился тот же самый визирь и сказал, я же принес его мол.

Tsez_Line: Xizyo xanä kidbeq esirnosi, t’akanyoł xizay howda wazir idur ayäƛin, ža wazir aynč’u, enda aysƛin, ganƛ’o zowali uži ukarno.
English_Translation: Then, when the king asked his daughter: "Did this vizier come home for the glass?", [she said:] "This vizier didn't come, he came!" and showed him the boy on the bull calf.
Russian_Translation: Затем царь спросил дочери, пришел ли этот визирь за стаканом. Он не подходил, а тот пришел, указала на юношу, который сидел на быке.

Tsez_Line: Łina sipat-suratyoƛ’ ža ayäƛin babiya esirnosi, kidbä kinaw šebin esin, sosi t’umi bays, nełłäy žek’-bok’ełno ukrus his yołäsi miƛ’i boqsi, xizyo neł miƛ’iłäygon užin oqno t’akan esirnosi, teƛno din egirsiƛin.
English_Translation: "What shape did he arrive in?", asked the father, and his daughter told him the entire thing: "At first, a pigeon came, the it shook itself and became a ram with silver whool, afterwards that ram became a boy again, asked for the glass; I gave him the glass and let him go."
Russian_Translation: Отец спросил, каким обликом он пришел мол, и девушка рассказала обо всем, сперва голубь пришел, он встряхнулся и превратился в барана с золотой шерстью, затем из этого баран обратился в юношу, спросил у меня стакан, а я дала и отправила.

Tsez_Line: Neła t’umiqay bˤaƛ’uru ħuli babiwz k’ukyoł boqun, miƛ’iłäy räšruni mesedyosnigon his ħamarno čˤaƛin esirno, baba, req’ezi roqxaƛin.
English_Translation: She put the feather that fell from that pigeon onto her father's hat, and threw the golden whool that fell from the ram onto the chest and asked: "Daddy, does it fit?"
Russian_Translation: Перо, которое уронил голубь, вколола в шапку отца, а шерсть, которая повалилась с барана, бросил на грудь, и спросила, папа, подходит ли мол.

Tsez_Line: C’aq’ req’ezi roqxo, dey kidƛin, babiyan žawab teƛno.
English_Translation: "It fits very well, my daughter", answered the father.
Russian_Translation: Очень подходит, моя дочь мол, ответил отец.

Tsez_Line: Xanä wazires meč’no beč’no, t’akan nesiqor yayäruni žax, ixiw bertenno bodin, kidno yegirno.
English_Translation: The king cut off the vizier's head, arranged a big wedding and gave his daughter to the boy who brought him his glass.
Russian_Translation: Царь отсек голову визира, сыграл большую свадьбу и выдал дочь за того, кто нес ему стакан.

Tsez_Line: Däzoq’aw ɣˤutkun rodoƛin, xanä eƛin kidbez xedyoqor, maday madargon mesedyos ƛen eroƛin.
English_Translation: "Build a house like mine", said the king to his daughter's husband, "and construct a golden bridge from door to door!"
Russian_Translation: Царь сказал мужу дочери, построишь дом наподобие моего и со двора на двор установишь золотой мост.

Tsez_Line: Sasaqtow moƛaxay izizaƛ’or, nesä äƛiruxor rodäsi reže ɣˤutkun, nesiz maday kidbez madär kuräsi mesedyos ƛen bukayzaƛ’, xan haqan ogun ezun ƛexun.
English_Translation: The next morning after getting up from sleeping, he built a big house as said, and when the king saw the golden bridge erected from his door to his daughter's door, he remained looking at it with an open mouth.
Russian_Translation: Царь удивился, когда завтра же утром, пока он не встал, увидел построивший большой дом, как он сказал, и протянутый золотой мост от его двора до двора дочери.

Tsez_Line: Mesedyoztow ƛäƛ’ kidbedäɣorgon ik’inosi, elo mesedyos ric’äsi istowli resun.
English_Translation: When he went over the golden bridge to his daughter, he found a table filled with gold there.
Russian_Translation: По золотому же мосту пошел к дочери, там нашел стол полный золота.

Tsez_Line: Ik’in yisä reƛ’a atinosi, mesed nˤoƛaƛ’or butin.
English_Translation: When he went and touched it with his hand, the gold turned into ashes.
Russian_Translation: Когда он пошел и трогал рукой, золото превратилось в золу...

Tsez_Line: Xizorgon roɣnosi, yałru mesed boqno.
English_Translation: When he took it back, it turned back into the gold that it was.
Russian_Translation: убрал обратно, остался обычным золотом.

Tsez_Line: Xizyo xanä esirno žaq, nediw hunar yołäsi šida mi eni-babiya bazarganzar teƛno, žedagon där neƛaƛin.
English_Translation: Afterwards, the king asked the boy: "Why did your parents gave you - who has such talents - to the merchants and they in turn gave you to me?"
Russian_Translation: Потом царь спросил юношу, ты такой талантливый, почему тебя продали купцам, а они дали мне мол.

Tsez_Line: Užä eƛin, där howži roqxozo łinałäyn yukayru moƛu ya eni-babiwq, ya žedu bazarganzaq esinč’izaƛ’ žeda di teƛsiƛin.
English_Translation: The boy said: "They gave me away, because I told neither my parents nor those merchants, that I had a dream in which I saw what would happen now."
Russian_Translation: Юноша сказал, меня они продали потому, что о сне, который я видел о том, что со мной должно было сейчас происходить, я не рассказал ни родителям, ни купцам.

Tsez_Line: Žeduq ža moƛugon esis yołi, di yałruxor ƛexa zowsƛin.
English_Translation: Had I told them this dream instead, I would have remained what I was.
Russian_Translation: Если бы рассказал им об этом сне, я бы остался таким же мол.

Tsez_Line: Xanägon žas eni-babiw goƛ’a žek’un egirno, neł quł sasaqtow žedun bayrno.
English_Translation: And the king then sent a man to call the boy's parents, and in the next morning, he brought them.
Russian_Translation: Царь отправил человека пригласить родителей юноши и привел их на следующий же день.

Tsez_Line: Nełƛ’ay soder eniwn, babiwn žade paraxat bercinłiƛ’ xanzo ʕaƛa ʕumru bodix bičin.
English_Translation: After that, the mother and the father lived beautifully and calmly in the village of the king, next to their son.
Russian_Translation: С тех пор мать и отец с сыном спокойно жили в царском селе.

Tsez_Line: K’uruč’ k’eč’ ɣudi rocu, buq bay.
English_Translation: All's well that end's well.
Russian_Translation: Куруч, бусинка, пусть проясняется день и восходит солнце.

Tsez_Line: Esin šebi, xecin šebi sis zown q’ˤano halmaɣ.
English_Translation: Once upon a time there were two friends.

Tsez_Line: Žedułäy sis zown igu, sis zown žuka.
English_Translation: One of them was good, one of them was bad.

Tsez_Line: Sida quł žedu sadaq hunix bik’a keze boqno.
English_Translation: One day they happened to go somewhere together.

Tsez_Line: Hunix mekʷa c’oxnosi, žeda sosi iguni halmaɣes bišʷa rac’no łiyrno.
English_Translation: When they became hungry on their way, the first ate up the good friend's food.

Tsez_Line: Xizyo iguni halmaɣƛ’o mekʷan c’oxno, žukaniq bišʷan esirno, sosigon bišno žedu.
English_Translation: Afterwards, the good friend got hungry and asked the bad one for food, and they ate first.

Tsez_Line: K’ox äƛirugon mekoyn iguni halmaɣä biša esirnosi, nesä inkar boyn, deber di sosi neƛinč’aƛin.
English_Translation: When the good friend was hungry for the second time, he asked for food, but he [the other one] rejected: "Didn't I give you something first?"

Tsez_Line: Xizyogon žukani halmaɣä eƛin, deber bišʷa retinäy, roɣno mi där sis ozuri neƛƛin.
English_Translation: Then the bad friend said: "If you want food, take one eye out and give it to me!"

Tsez_Line: Mekos nece ħal boqzaƛ’, roɣno ozuri teƛnosi dandi, žukani halmaɣä igunir rac’a biša teƛno.
English_Translation: Because the hunger's strength got so big, he took away his eye and gave it to him, and the bad friend gave the good one food to eat, right away.

Tsez_Line: Xizyogon mekʷa c’oxno iguni halmaɣä žukaniq bišʷa esirnosi, q’ˤano äƛirugon ozuri roɣno nesir teƛzaƛ’or išernoanu ža žukani halmaɣä.
English_Translation: Again, the good friend became hungry and asked the bad one for food, and the bad friend didn't let him eat before he didn't take away his second eye and gave it to him.

Tsez_Line: Hemedur q’ˤunan ozurazaƛ’ayn ok’ek’no iguni halmaɣ žukanä, howlotow žan xecin oxin nesidäy.
English_Translation: So the bad one had stolen the two eyes from the the good friend, left him there and ran away from him.

Tsez_Line: Hudun ža ozzatawni žek’u harihun ƛaƛaƛix ik’in, sidaɣ aɣˤuxor keze oqno.
English_Translation: Nevertheless, this eyeless man went slowly feeling up and got to a mill someplace.

Tsez_Line: Elor aynosi, mogolarno izin, kecno ičin.
English_Translation: Having arrived there, he got into the granary and went to sleep.

Tsez_Line: Hemeła qułtow mogolxo elo aɣˤuxor zeyn, zirun, boc’in rayn.
English_Translation: The next day, a bear, a fox and a wolf came there to the mill at the granary.

Tsez_Line: Zeyä žedaqor eƛin, hemeł beženi ʕaƛa łi anuƛax.
English_Translation: The bear said to them: "It's said that there's no water in this big village.

Tsez_Line: Elo ʕaƛoł roƛƛo ixiw naħuz ɣuna teł łi yołƛax.
English_Translation: There's supposed to be water inside a big oak in the middle of the village.

Tsez_Line: Elay ža maħor łi roƛäk’rur, žamaʕatyo ʕaƛos boƛƛik’u ric’q’i neƛxoƛax.
English_Translation: They say that the assembly of the village would give half their wealth in order to get the water out there.

Tsez_Line: Žaƛa šebiƛin, boc’ä eƛin, pulanaw xan untizi oqäsiƛax.
English_Translation: How's that?", and the wolf said: "It's said that some king became sick."

Tsez_Line: Nesiztow bˤeƛ’eł yałru biƛurox aluk’ani bˤeƛ’q’ˤus reƛ rac’näy, ža xan saɣ oqxosi yałrułin xalq’imor riyxanu.
English_Translation: When he eats the meat of a sheep from his flock, which is white on its belly, this king will be healed; but the people don't know this.

Tsez_Line: Łemu boƛƛik’u ric’q’i xanqayn bäqiƛin.
English_Translation: Otherwise, get half of the wealth from the king!"

Tsez_Line: Žagon šebiƛin, zira eƛin.
English_Translation: "How's that?", said the fox.

Tsez_Line: Sisgon xalq’imor riyxanusi šebin, łiłiroƛ’ ƛ’iri sis ažo yoł.
English_Translation: "One thing that the people don't know is that there's a tree above the ditch.

Tsez_Line: Nełaq yoqäsi q’ˤano ƛˤeb yoł.
English_Translation: There are two leaves growing on it.

Tsez_Line: Becawni žek’a ža ozzaq yiħinäy, neła kanłi bayrxoƛax.
English_Translation: If the blind man smears them onto his eyes, it brings back his eyesight.

Tsez_Line: Žeda bexurxozo xabaryoqor aħyan kurno aɣˤuz mogola tełerno oqno ozatawni žek’un ičäsi zown.
English_Translation: After they finished talking(?), the blind man perked up his ears, got into the mill's granary and waited.

Tsez_Line: Zeyn, zirun, boc’in elo sasaqorno ričin, qˤašiƛ’aɣor roqno rik’in.
English_Translation: The bear, the fox and the wolf waited there until the morning and when it got dawn, they went away.

Tsez_Line: Qˤašinosi ža žek’u izin mogolay q’ˤidarno oqno, harihun łiłiroxsi łiłiroxno ik’in, zira äƛiruni ɣun resurno.
English_Translation: When it dawned, the man got up and down from the granary, and slowly went to the ditch's ditch(?) and found the tree the fox has talked about

Tsez_Line: Nełaqno izin reƛ’iqor yiqi yäqiru ƛˤeb ozqo yiħixt’a kurxo zown.
English_Translation: He reached up with his hand and smeared a plucked leaf onto an eye, and threw it away.

Tsez_Line: Zamanałäy yisiq ozzałer kanłi bayrxosi ƛˤeb yiqin.
English_Translation: After a while, he picked up a leaf that brought back his eyesight to his eyes again.

Tsez_Line: Sisgon ƛˤeb yet’urno yiħinosi, hoq’ˤonigon ozłer kanłi bayn.
English_Translation: He pulled out a single leaf and after smearing it [onto his eye], the other eye got its eyesight back.

Tsez_Line: Q’ˤunan ozzar rukaynosi, aɣˤuxay bitor hunix oqno yeda zeyä äƛiruni hemeł ʕaƛaɣor.
English_Translation: When both of his eyes saw again, he got on his way away from the mill to the village that the bear had talked about.

Tsez_Line: Elo yisä godek’anya q’ˤida bäčiru ʕoloqzaq łi esirnosi, sidä izin zok’är aqˤun kučin teƛƛ’oräy, nesä eƛin, eleley, yedu šebi šebin, insanä aqˤuyä łäz meča ħaƛuƛin, nediw šebin behizi raqinč’iƛin.
English_Translation: There he asked a young person who sat at the village square for water, and one got up, pissed into a mug and gave it to him and he said: "Behold, what is this? A human is not allowed such a thing as to drink urine instead of water!"

Tsez_Line: Hudu ela šebi rodan, t’o ʕaƛa t’ok’ow łin roqinč’inäy, elurno bac’adaw kikes łi räti riqinäyƛin, eƛin nesi žek’uqor žamaʕatyoz ʕoloqza.
English_Translation: "So what shall we do? If there's no more water in the village here, we want water from a clean spring if we could get it.", said the young person to this man.

Tsez_Line: Xizyo nesä žeduqor eƛin, howt’o ʕaƛa di łi roƛik’näy, šebi meža där baha boyxƛin.
English_Translation: Afterwards he said to them: "If I pull out water here in the village, what price do you pay me?"

Tsez_Line: Žeda eƛin, ʕaƛos boƛik’u ric’q’i neƛa yołƛin.
English_Translation: They said: "We will give [you] half the wealth of the village!"

Tsez_Line: Bik’i däqor ʕo risoƛin, eƛin nesi žek’a.
English_Translation: "Go and get me an ax!", said the man.

Tsez_Line: Howlotow boƛƛi godek’anyä zawru naħus nesä ʕon rok’-rok’no rečiw łi roƛik’no.
English_Translation: Then he hit the oak in the middle of the village square with the ax and drew thick water out of it.

Tsez_Line: Xizyo nesir žamaʕatyo q’ut’oƛ’ req’un boƛik’u ric’q’i teƛno, bˤeƛ’no, ɣuron, žedaxorgon aħobin, ɣˤʷaybin, siršaɣˤʷade sadaqgon hokombin, roƛik’u partal-q’ayn, qˤičin, ƛ’irigon kumakyor xalq’in begirno nesiq, žan hunix egirno.
English_Translation: Afterwards, the assembly gave him - according to the agreement - half their wealth, sheep, cows, shepherds and dogs for them, carriages together with horses along them, half the property, the harvest, and above that, they sent people to help him, and let him go his way.

Tsez_Line: Elaygon bitor ža boc’ä äƛiruni untarawni xander ik’in.
